page.title: 06INTERVIEW WITH REV. PHILLIPS
page.content: Rev.Peter Phillips & his wife Betty are a couple in their 50's.They were born in Weston Super Mare,but have lived in various parts of the country. Mr Phillips still speaks with a slight Somerset accent.They have been in this area for 14 months,and hope to stay until retirement.They find the community a very close one,in which the extended family is very important. The changes in trade in the area is drawing New and Old Arley together,and Mr Phillips is pleased about this.Many people work at the industrial estate, which is on the site of the old pit, and less distinction is being made between New and Old Arley.Unemployment is less of a problem than in large centres,as many people are in farming and work on the industrial estate, although Dawmill tends to take more people from local villages.
